 595+ CCEF                                      include "./ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm"
# file opened: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
   1++CCEF              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++CCEF
   3++CCEF 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++CCF0 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++CCF1 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++CCF2 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++CCF3 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++CCF4 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++CCF5 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++CCF6              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++CCF6 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++CCF7 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++CCF8 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++CCF9 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++CCFB              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++CCFB              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++CCFB 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++CCFC
  19++CCFC
  20++CCFC              ; bounds check and the start to avoid dxy calcs if off screen, eliminating off screens first saves a lot of uncessary mul/div
  21++CCFC              ;ClipXX15XX12Line:
  22++CCFC ED 4B 85 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3)
  23++CD00 DD 2A 89 C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1)
  24++CD04 2A 83 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1)
  25++CD07 ED 5B 87 C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5)
  26++CD0B AF                                   xor     a
  27++CD0C 32 F8 CC                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  28++CD0F 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  29++CD10 FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX
  30++CD13                                      ;       push    af
  31++CD13                                      ;       ld      a,iyh
  32++CD13                                      ;       ld      (regX),a
  33++CD13                                      ;       pop     af
  34++CD13 DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  35++CD15 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  36++CD17 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  37++CD19 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  38++CD1C 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  39++CD1E FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  40++CD21                                      ;        push    af
  41++CD21                                      ;        ld      a,iyh
  42++CD21                                      ;        ld      (regX),a
  43++CD21                                      ;        pop     af
  44++CD21              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  45++CD21              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  46++CD21 FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  47++CD23 32 FB CC                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  48++CD26 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  49++CD27 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  50++CD28 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  51++CD2A 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  52++CD2B ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  53++CD2E 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  54++CD30              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  55++CD30 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  56++CD32 FE 00                                cp      0
  57++CD34 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  58++CD36              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++CD36 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  60++CD37 32 84 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  61++CD3A DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  62++CD3C 32 86 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  63++CD3F 7D                                   ld      a,l
  64++CD40 32 83 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  65++CD43 7B                                   ld      a,e
  66++CD44 32 85 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  67++CD47                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  67++CD47 B7          >                        or a
  68++CD48 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  69++CD49              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  70++CD49 37           .PointsOutofBounds:     scf                                 ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  71++CD4A C9                                   ret
  72++CD4B FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  73++CD4D B7                                   or      a
  74++CD4E 1F                                   rra
  75++CD4F FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  76++CD51                                      ;        push    af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  77++CD51                                      ;        ld      a,iyh               ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  78++CD51                                      ;        ld      (regX),a            ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  79++CD51                                      ;        pop     af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  80++CD51 FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  81++CD53 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  82++CD56 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  83++CD58 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  84++CD59 A2                                   and     d
  85++CD5A                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  85++CD5A FA 49 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  86++CD5D 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  87++CD5E DD A4                                and     ixh
  88++CD60                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CD60 FA 49 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  89++CD63 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  90++CD64 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CD65 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  92++CD67                                      ;        push    af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  93++CD67                                      ;        ld      a,iyl              ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  94++CD67                                      ;        ld      (varXX12p2),a      ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  95++CD67                                      ;        pop     af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  96++CD67 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  97++CD68 3D                                   dec     a
  98++CD69 FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  99++CD6B                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  99++CD6B F2 49 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 100++CD6E              ;by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
 101++CD6E DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
 102++CD70 3D                                   dec     a
 103++CD71 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 104++CD73 78                                   ld      a,b
 105++CD74 3D                                   dec     a
 106++CD75 FD B5                                or      iyl
 107++CD77                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
 107++CD77 F2 49 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 108++CD7A 79                                   ld      a,c
 109++CD7B DD A5                                and     ixl
 110++CD7D                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
 110++CD7D FA 49 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
 111++CD80              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++CD80              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++CD80              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++CD80 B7          >                        or a
 114++CD81 E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++CD83 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++CD84 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++CD86                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++CD86 22 EF CC                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 119++CD89 7C                                   ld      a,h
 120++CD8A 32 F1 CC                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 121++CD8D                                     ; ld      a,e                         ;a = x2 lo
 122++CD8D                                     ; sbc     a,l                         ;a= a - x1
 123++CD8D                                     ; ld      (clipDx),a
 124++CD8D                                     ; ld      a,d
 125++CD8D                                     ; sbc     a,h
 126++CD8D                                     ; ld      (clipDxHigh),a                ; later we will just move to sub hl,de
 127++CD8D                                     ; ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a          ; it looks liek we need this later post scale loop
 128++CD8D              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 128++CD8D B7          >                        or a
 129++CD8E DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 130++CD91 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CD93 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CD95 22 F2 CC                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CD98 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CD99                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CD99                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CD99                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CD99                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CD99                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CD99                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CD99                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CD99
 142++CD99              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CD99                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CD99 21 F0 CC                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 145++CD9C AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 146++CD9D 32 18 98                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 147++CDA0 32 F5 CC                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 148++CDA3 3A F3 CC     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CDA6 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CDA9 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CDAB 2A F2 CC                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CDAE                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CDAE AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CDAF 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CDB0 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CDB1 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 152++CDB2 92          >                    sub 	d
 152++CDB3 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CDB4 22 F2 CC                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CDB7 2A EF CC     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CDBA 3A F0 CC                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CDBD ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CDC0 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CDC2                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CDC2                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CDC2 AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CDC3 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CDC4 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CDC5 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CDC6 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CDC7 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CDC8                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CDC8              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CDC8                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CDC8                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CDC8 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CDC9 B2                                   or      d
 166++CDCA 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CDCC
 167++CDCC                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CDCC CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CDCE CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CDD0                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CDD0 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CDD2 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CDD4 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CDD6              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CDD6                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CDD6              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CDD6 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CDD7 32 33 98                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CDDA 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CDDB                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CDDB BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CDDC DA EC CD    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 177++CDDF              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CDDF 32 16 98     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CDE2 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CDE3 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CDE4 CD 7A A9                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CDE7 32 17 98                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CDEA 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CDEC              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CDEC 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CDED 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CDEE 32 16 98                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CDF1 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CDF2 CD 7A A9                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CDF5 32 17 98                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CDF8 21 33 98                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CDFB 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CDFC D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CDFD E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CDFE 3A 17 98                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CE01 32 F4 CC                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CE04 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CE06                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CE06                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CE06                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CE06                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CE06 3A 18 98                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CE09 32 F5 CC                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CE0C                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CE0C FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CE0E FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CE10 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CE12 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CE15 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CE17              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CE17 CD 3E CE     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CE1A FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CE1C ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CE1F 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CE21              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CE21 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CE22 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CE23 C2 49 CD                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CE26 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CE27 FA 49 CD                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CE2A              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CE2A              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CE2A EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CE2B DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CE2D C5                                   push    bc
 226++CE2E DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CE30 C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CE31 CD 3E CE                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CE34 3A F8 CC                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CE37 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CE38 32 F8 CC                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CE3B C3 36 CD     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CE3E
 234++CE3E              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CE3E              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CE3E 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CE3F ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CE42 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CE44 32 18 98     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CE47 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CE4A CD C0 CE                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CE4D                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CE4D                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CE4D C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CE50 2A F9 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CE53              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CE53                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CE53 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CE54 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CE56 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CE59               ;                       pop     de
 252++CE59 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CE5B FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CE5D 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CE5F 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CE60 32 18 98                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CE63 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CE66 CD C0 CE                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CE69                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CE69                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CE69 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CE6C                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CE6C 2A F9 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CE6F                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CE6F 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CE70 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CE72                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CE72                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CE72                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CE72 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CE75                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CE75              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CE75 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CE76 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CE79 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CE7B 32 18 98                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CE7E 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CE7F 32 17 98                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CE82 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CE85 CD E7 CE                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CE88                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CE88                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CE88 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CE8B D5                                   push    de
 285++CE8C EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CE8D 2A F9 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CE90 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CE91 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CE92 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CE95 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CE96 E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CE98 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CE99 C8                                   ret     z
 294++CE9A E5                                   push    hl
 295++CE9B 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CE9D 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CEA0 B7                                   or      a
 298++CEA1 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CEA3 22 17 98                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CEA6 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CEA7 E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CEA8 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CEAB C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CEAC              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CEAC E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CEAF CD E7 CE                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CEB2                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CEB2                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CEB2 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CEB5 D5                                   push    de
 311++CEB6 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CEB7 2A F9 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CEBA 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CEBB 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CEBE D1                                   pop     de
 316++CEBF C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CEC0
 318++CEC0
 319++CEC0              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CEC0              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CEC0              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CEC0              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CEC0 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CEC1 32 17 98                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CEC4 CD 2F CF                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CEC7 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CEC8 C5                                   push    bc
 328++CEC9 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CECA 3A 33 98                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CECD FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CECF 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CED0 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CED1 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CED3              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CED3 3A F4 CC     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CED6 32 16 98                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CED9 CD F8 A7                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CEDC 22 F9 CC                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CEDF F1                                   pop     af
 340++CEE0 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CEE3 CA 22 CF                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CEE6 C9                                   ret
 343++CEE7              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CEE7              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CEE7              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CEE7              ;
 347++CEE7              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CEE7              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CEE7              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CEE7 CD 2F CF     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CEEA F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CEEB C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CEEC 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CEED 3A 33 98                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CEF0 FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CEF2 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CEF3 C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CEF4 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CEF6              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CEF6 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CEF9 2A 17 98                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CEFC 3A 16 98                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CEFF 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CF00              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CF00 CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CF02 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CF04 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CF05 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CF07                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CF07 B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CF08 DA 13 CF    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 368++CF0B 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CF0C 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CF0D 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CF0E 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CF0F DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CF11 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CF12 3F                                   ccf
 375++CF13              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CF13 CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CF15 CB 12       >               rl  d
 376++CF17 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CF19 ED 53 F9 CC                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CF1D F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CF1E ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CF21 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CF22 2A F9 CC     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CF25                                      NegHL
 382++CF25 AF          >                    xor a
 382++CF26 95          >                    sub l
 382++CF27 6F          >                    ld l,a
 382++CF28 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 382++CF29 94          >                    sub h
 382++CF2A 67          >                    ld h,a
 383++CF2B 22 F9 CC                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CF2E C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CF2F              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CF2F              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CF2F              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CF2F              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CF2F 3A F4 CC     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CF32 32 16 98                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CF35 3A 18 98                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CF38 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CF3A ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CF3D 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CF3F 2A 17 98                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CF42                                      NegHL
 396++CF42 AF          >                    xor a
 396++CF43 95          >                    sub l
 396++CF44 6F          >                    ld l,a
 396++CF45 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 396++CF46 94          >                    sub h
 396++CF47 67          >                    ld h,a
 397++CF48 22 17 98                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CF4B 21 F5 CC     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CF4E F1                                   pop     af
 400++CF4F AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CF50 E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CF51 C9                                   ret
 403++CF52
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 596+ CF52              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 597+ CF52                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CF52              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CF52              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CF52              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CF52              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CF52              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CF52              CopyRotmatToTransMat:                       ; Tested
   7++CF52 21 15 C0     LL15_CopyRotMat:        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
   8++CF55
   9++CF55 11 3E C0                             ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  10++CF58                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  10++CF58 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF5A ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF5C ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF5E ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF60 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF62 ED A0       >                        ldi
  11++CF64 21 1B C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  12++CF67 11 44 C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  13++CF6A                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  13++CF6A ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF6C ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF6E ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF70 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF72 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF74 ED A0       >                        ldi
  14++CF76 21 21 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX
  15++CF79 11 4A C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatNosevX
  16++CF7C                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  16++CF7C ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CF7E ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CF80 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CF82 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CF84 ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CF86 ED A0       >                        ldi
  17++CF88 C9                                   ret
  18++CF89
  19++CF89              CopyRotToTransMacro:    MACRO
  20++CF89 ~                                    ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
  21++CF89 ~                                    ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  22++CF89 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  23++CF89 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  24++CF89 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  25++CF89                                      ENDM
  26++CF89
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
 598+ CF89                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CF89              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CF89 2A 89 C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CF8C 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CF8D E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CF8F 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CF90                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CF90 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CF91 E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CF93 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CF94                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CF94 ED 5B 0C C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CF98 3A 0E C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CF9B E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CF9D 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CF9E CD 29 AE     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CFA1 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CFA2 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CFA3 22 83 C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CFA6              ; ..................................
  20++CFA6 2A 8B C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CFA9 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CFAA E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CFAC 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CFAD                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CFAD 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CFAE E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CFB0 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CFB1                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CFB1 ED 5B 0F C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++CFB5 3A 11 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++CFB8 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++CFBA 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++CFBB CD 29 AE     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++CFBE B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++CFBF 67           		ld		h,a
  36++CFC0 22 85 C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++CFC3              ; ..................................
  38++CFC3 2A 8D C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++CFC6 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++CFC7 E6 80        		and		$80
  41++CFC9 47           		ld		b,a
  42++CFCA                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++CFCA 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++CFCB E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++CFCD 67                   ld      h,a
  46++CFCE                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++CFCE ED 5B 12 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++CFD2 3A 14 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++CFD5 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++CFD7 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++CFD8 CD 29 AE     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++CFDB B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++CFDC 67           		ld		h,a
  54++CFDD CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++CFDF 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++CFE1 E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++CFE3 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++CFE5 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++CFE6              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++CFE6 FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++CFE8 DA F7 CF    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++CFEB              NoClampZto4:
  61++CFEB 22 87 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++CFEE 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++CFEF 32 33 98             ld      (varT),a
  64++CFF2 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++CFF3 32 15 98             ld      (varU),a
  66++CFF6 C9           		ret
  67++CFF7              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++CFF7 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++CFFA 22 87 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++CFFD 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++CFFE 32 33 98             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++D001 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++D002 32 15 98             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++D005 C9           		ret
  75++D006
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 599+ D006                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++D006              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++D006 ED 4B 87 C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++D00A 2A 83 C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++D00D ED 5B 85 C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++D011              SetABSbc:
   6++D011 78           	ld			a,b
   7++D012 DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++D014 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++D016 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++D017              SetABShl:
  11++D017 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++D018 DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++D01A E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++D01C 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++D01D              SetABSde:
  16++D01D 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++D01E FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++D020 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++D022 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++D023              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++D023 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++D024 B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++D025 B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++D026 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++D028                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++D028 CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++D02A CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++D02C                  ShiftDERight1
  26++D02C CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++D02E CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++D030              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++D030 CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++D032 CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++D034 C3 23 D0         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++D037              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++D037 DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++D039 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++D03B B0           	or			b
  33++D03C 47           	ld			b,a
  34++D03D              SignforHL:
  35++D03D DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++D03F E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++D041 B4           	or			h
  38++D042 67           	ld			h,a
  39++D043              SignforDE:
  40++D043 FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++D045 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++D047 B2           	or			d
  43++D048 57           	ld			d,a
  44++D049              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++D049 ED 43 87 C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++D04D 22 83 C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++D050 ED 53 85 C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++D054 78           	ld			a,b
  49++D055 32 15 98     	ld			(varU),a
  50++D058 79           	ld			a,c
  51++D059 32 33 98     	ld			(varT),a
  52++D05C C9           	ret
  53++D05D
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 610+ D06B AF                                   xor     a

 615+ D071 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 616+ D073 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4  TODO add this into blueprint data for speed                                                           ;;; For loop = 15 to 0

 618+ D076 21 B0 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray

 621+ D07B 77           EE30:                   ld      (hl),a

 623+ D07D 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesVisibleLoop

 625+ D080              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 626+ D080 3A 18 C3     SetAllFacesHidden:      ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+ShipHullFacesCount                           ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 627+ D083 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 628+ D085 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4                                                                                  ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 629+ D087 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 630+ D088 06 10                                ld      b,16
 631+ D08A 21 B0 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 632+ D08D 3E 00                                ld      a,$00
 633+ D08F 77           SetAllFacesHiddenLoop:  ld      (hl),a
 634+ D090 23                                   inc     hl

 639+ D094              ;;;;ZtempHi = zhi
 640+ D094              ;;;;......................................................
 641+ D094              ;;;; if ztemp hi <> 0                                   ::Scale Object Distance
 642+ D094              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90
 643+ D094              ;;;;     inc X
 644+ D094              ;;;;     divide X, Y & ZtempHiLo by 2
 645+ D094              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 646+ D094              ;;;;......................................................
 647+ D094              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 648+ D094                                      include "Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++D094              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++D094              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++D094 47               ld      b,a
   4++D095 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++D097 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++D099 3A 16 98         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++D09C 5F               ld      e,a
   8++D09D              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++D09D              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++D09D              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++D09D 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++D0A0 78               ld      a,b
  13++D0A1 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++D0A3              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++D0A3 CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++D0A5 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++D0A6 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++D0A8 ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++D0AA 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++D0AC 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++D0AD 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++D0AE              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++D0AE 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++D0B0 79               ld      a,c
  25++D0B1 32 17 98         ld      (varR),a
  26++D0B4 C9               ret
  27++D0B5
  28++D0B5              ; Tested OK
  29++D0B5              NormaliseTransMat:
  30++D0B5              ;LL21
  31++D0B5 21 4F C0             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  32++D0B8 0E C5                ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  33++D0BA 79                   ld      a,c
  34++D0BB 32 16 98             ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  35++D0BE 06 09                ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  36++D0C0              LL21Loop:
  37++D0C0 56                   ld      d,(hl)
  38++D0C1 2B                   dec     hl
  39++D0C2 5E                   ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  40++D0C3                      ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  40++D0C3 CB 23       >			   sla e
  40++D0C5 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  41++D0C7 7A                   ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  42++D0C8 E5           		push	hl
  43++D0C9 C5           		push	bc
  44++D0CA CD 94 D0             call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  45++D0CD              		;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  46++D0CD 79                   ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  47++D0CE C1           		pop		bc
  48++D0CF E1           		pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  49++D0D0 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  50++D0D1 2B                   dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  51++D0D2 10 EC                djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  52++D0D4 C9                   ret
  53++D0D5
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm

 650+ D0D5
 651+ D0D5              ; Now we have
 652+ D0D5              ;   * XX18(2 1 0) = (x_sign x_hi x_lo)
 653+ D0D5              ;   * XX18(5 4 3) = (y_sign y_hi y_lo)
 654+ D0D5              ;   * XX18(8 7 6) = (z_sign z_hi z_lo)

 657+ D0D5                                      include "Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
   1++D0D5              ; TESTEDOK
   2++D0D5
   3++D0D5              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++D0D5              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++D0D5              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++D0D5              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++D0D5              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x
   8++D0D5              ;        ld      a,(hl)
   9++D0D5              ;ScaleNode:
  10++D0D5              ;        ld      b,ixl
  11++D0D5              ;ScaleNodeLoop:
  12++D0D5              ;        sla      a
  13++D0D5              ;        djnz    ScaleNodeLoop
  14++D0D5              ;        ld      (hl),a
  15++D0D5              ;        inc     hl

  21++D0D5
  22++D0D5              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++D0D5              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++D0D5              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++D0D5              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++D0D5              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++D0D5              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++D0D5              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++D0D5              ; OUTPUT
  30++D0D5              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++D0D5              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++D0D5              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++D0D5              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++D0D5 2A 3E C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++D0D8 ED 5B 44 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++D0DC ED 4B 4A C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++D0E0 22 56 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++D0E3 ED 53 58 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++D0E7 ED 43 5A C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++D0EB 2A 40 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++D0EE ED 5B 46 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++D0F2 ED 4B 4C C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++D0F6 22 5E C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++D0F9 ED 53 60 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++D0FD ED 43 62 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++D101 2A 42 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++D104 ED 5B 48 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++D108 ED 4B 4E C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++D10C 22 66 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++D10F ED 53 68 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++D113 ED 43 6A C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++D117 C9                   ret
  53++D118
  54++D118
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
 658+ D118              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 659+ D118              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 660+ D118              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 661+ D118              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 662+ D118              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 663+ D118              ; Returns
 664+ D118              ;
 665+ D118              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 666+ D118              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 667+ D118              ;
 668+ D118              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 669+ D118              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 670+ D118              ;
 671+ D118              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 672+ D118              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 673+ D118              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 674+ D118 ~                                    ld      c,0
 675+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 676+ D118 ~                                    bit     7,a
 677+ D118 ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 678+ D118 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 679+ D118 ~                                    neg
 680+ D118 ~                                    ld      c,$80
 681+ D118 ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 682+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 683+ D118 ~                                    bit     7,a
 684+ D118 ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 685+ D118 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 686+ D118 ~                                    neg
 687+ D118 ~                                    ld      b,a
 688+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,c
 689+ D118 ~                                    xor     $80
 690+ D118 ~                                    ld      c,a
 691+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,b
 692+ D118 ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 693+ D118 ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 694+ D118 ~                                    mul
 695+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,c
 696+ D118 ~                                    bit     7,a
 697+ D118 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 698+ D118 ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 699+ D118 ~                                    neg
 700+ D118 ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 701+ D118                                      ENDM
 702+ D118
 703+ D118
 704+ D118               ; TESTEDOK
 705+ D118              XX12DotOneRow:
 706+ D118              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 706+ D118 3A 83 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 706+ D11B 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 706+ D11C 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 706+ D11D 57          >                        ld      d,a
 706+ D11E ED 30       >                        mul
 706+ D120 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 706+ D121 32 33 98    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 707+ D124 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 708+ D125              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 708+ D125 3A 84 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 708+ D128 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 709+ D129 32 18 98                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 710+ D12C 23                                   inc     hl
 711+ D12D              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 711+ D12D 3A 85 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 711+ D130 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 711+ D131 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 711+ D132 57          >                        ld      d,a
 711+ D133 ED 30       >                        mul
 711+ D135 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 711+ D136 32 16 98    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 712+ D139                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 712+ D139 3A 33 98    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 712+ D13C 32 17 98    >                        ld       (varR),a
 713+ D13F 23                                   inc     hl
 714+ D140                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 714+ D140 3A 86 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 714+ D143 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 715+ D144              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 716+ D144 E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 717+ D145 CD 47 AF                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 718+ D148 E1                                   pop     hl
 719+ D149 32 33 98                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 720+ D14C 23                                   inc     hl
 721+ D14D              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 721+ D14D 3A 87 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 721+ D150 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 721+ D151 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 721+ D152 57          >                        ld      d,a
 721+ D153 ED 30       >                        mul
 721+ D155 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 721+ D156 32 16 98    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 722+ D159                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 722+ D159 3A 33 98    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 722+ D15C 32 17 98    >                        ld       (varR),a
 723+ D15F 23                                   inc     hl
 724+ D160                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 724+ D160 3A 88 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 724+ D163 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 725+ D164              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 726+ D164 CD 47 AF                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 727+ D167              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 728+ D167 C9                                   ret
 729+ D168
 730+ D168
 731+ D168              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 732+ D168              ;TESTED OK
 733+ D168              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 734+ D168              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 735+ D168 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 736+ D16B 21 3E C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 737+ D16E CD 18 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 738+ D171 32 89 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 739+ D174 3A 18 98                             ld      a,(varS)
 740+ D177 32 8A C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 741+ D17A 21 44 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 742+ D17D CD 18 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 743+ D180 32 8B C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 744+ D183 3A 18 98                             ld      a,(varS)
 745+ D186 32 8C C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 746+ D189 21 4A C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 747+ D18C CD 18 D1                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 748+ D18F 32 8D C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 749+ D192 3A 18 98                             ld      a,(varS)
 750+ D195 32 8E C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 751+ D198 C9                                   ret
 752+ D199              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 753+ D199                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm
   1++D199              CopyXX12ScaledToXX18:

   1++D2F1              CopyXX12ToScaled:
   2++D2F1              CopyResultToScaled:

   3++D2F1 3A 89 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+0)
   3++D2F4 32 83 C0    >                        ld       (UBnkXScaled),a
   4++D2F7                      ldCopyByte  XX12+2,UBnkYScaled      ; ynormal lo
   4++D2F7 3A 8B C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+2)
   4++D2FA 32 85 C0    >                        ld       (UBnkYScaled),a
